questions.text: A 65 year old male presented with dysphagia in neck, Occasional regurgitation of old food and halitosis. Barium swallow revealed an outpouching from cervical esophagus. True statement about this condition is?

options.label: A
options.text: This is a type of acquired traction diverticulum.

options.label: B
options.text: This diverticulum comes from just below cricopharynx

options.label: C
options.text: Diverticulectomy and cricopharyngomyotomy is the best treatment

options.label: D
options.text: Best approach for surgery is through right neck.

questions.correct_answer: D. Best approach for surgery is through right neck.

questions.text: A 45 year old male presented with sever hyperkeratosis of palm and sole with mild dysphagia. Upper GI endoscopy revealed severe dysplastic changes. Which of the following condition is false about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: This is a autosomal dominant condition

options.label: B
options.text: This condition is associated with Chromosome 17q25 , gene RHBDF2

options.label: C
options.text: Risk of adenocarcinoma of esophagus is very high

options.label: D
options.text: Chromoendoscopy screening with Iodine solution is recommended after 20 years

questions.correct_answer: C. Risk of adenocarcinoma of esophagus is very high

questions.text: An upper GI series is performed on a 71-year-old woman who presented with several months of chest pain that occurred when she was eating. The film below is obtained. Investigation reveals a microcytic anemia and erosive gastritis on upper endoscopy. Which of the following statements about the patient’s condition is true?

options.label: B
options.text: The gastroesophageal junction is above the diaphragm

options.label: C
options.text: Ulceration, gastritis, and anaemia are common

options.label: D
options.text: It usually is treated by medical therapy

questions.correct_answer: D. It usually is treated by medical therapy

questions.text: A 32 year old male presented with sever upper abdominal pain and retching (no vomiting). Resident tried to pass Ryles tube but did not succeed. X ray and barium picture is given below. What is the next best step for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: CECT to rule out possibility of pseudocyst

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate laparotomy and repair of hiatus hernia

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate laparotomy and repair of Gastric volvulus

questions.correct_answer: D. Immediate laparotomy and repair of Gastric volvulus

questions.text: Best treatment for Boerhaave syndrome being operated after 3 days is?

options.label: A
options.text: Conservative with High grade antibiotics and TPN.

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate thoracotomy and primary closure of the tear.

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate thoracotomy and exteriorization of esophagus perforated area, lavage and feeding jejunsotomy with second stage repair.

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate thoracotomy with excision of esophageal tear area and repair by gastric pull up.

questions.correct_answer: C. Immediate thoracotomy and exteriorization of esophagus perforated area, lavage and feeding jejunsotomy with second stage repair.

questions.text: A 62-year-old man has been noticing progressive difficulty swallowing, first solid food and now liquids as well. A barium study shows a ragged narrowing just below the carinal level. After Endoscopic biopsy and PET CT he is diagnosed as a case of squamous cell carcinoma stage T2 N1M0. What is the best treatment option for him?

options.label: D
options.text: Ivor Lewis esophagectomy followed by Chemotherapy

questions.correct_answer: D. Ivor Lewis esophagectomy followed by Chemotherapy

questions.text: Advantage of Orringer esophagectomy is all except?

options.label: C
options.text: Less risk of leak (as compared to Ivor Lewis)

options.label: D
options.text: Ideal for lower/ Mid esophageal cancer

questions.correct_answer: C. Less risk of leak (as compared to Ivor Lewis)

questions.text: In an patient of AIDS who presented with Odynophagia, multiple small punched out and some volcano shaped ulcers were found. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a parameter used for “BLEED” risk criteria for a case of hematemesis?

A 54-year-old man presents with sudden onset of massive, painless, recurrent hematemesis. Upper endoscopy is performed and reveals bleeding from a lesion in the proximal stomach from the right wall 4 cm below GE junction and is characterized by an abnormally large artery surrounded by normal-appearing gastric mucosa. Endoscopic modalities fail to stop the bleeding. Which of the following is the most appropriate surgical management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Wedge resection of the lesion with truncal vagotomy

options.label: C
options.text: Wedge resection of the lesion with highly selective vagotomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Wedge resection of the lesion

questions.text: A 55-year-old man complains of chronic intermittent epigastric pain, and gastroscopy demonstrates a 2-cm ulcer of the distal lesser curvature (at incisura- Johnson’s type-1 ulcer). Endoscopic biopsy yields no malignant tissue. After a 6-wk trial of H2 blockade and antacid therapy, the ulcer is unchanged. Ideal surgical treatment for this patient would be?

A 45-year-old woman with history of prolonged nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ingestion presents with acute abdominal pain for one and half days. X ray revealed Rigler’s sign. She undergoes exploratory laparotomy and a perforated duodenal ulcer on the anterior wall was found. Which of the following is the procedure of choice to treat her perforation?

options.label: D
options.text: Highly selective vagotomy with omental patch

questions.correct_answer: A. Simple closure with omental patch

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with a history of chronic peptic ulcer disease undergoes a truncal vagotomy and antrectomy with a Billroth II reconstruction for gastric outlet obstruction. Six weeks after surgery, he returns with complains of postprandial weakness, sweating, light-headedness, crampy abdominal pain, and diarrhoea. Which of the following should not be advised for treatment of this case?

options.label: B
options.text: Treatment with a long-acting somatostatin analogue

questions.text: A patient who had undergone partial gastrectomy 15 year ago for APD presented with gradually increasing weakness and fatigue, and numbness of toes and feet. He is afebrile but shows pallor and glossitis. He has a broad based gate and absent vibration and position sense over lower limb. Romberg test is positive. His HB is 10.0 gm%.; TLC is 4500 /cmm; platelet is 1.3 lac/cmm. Which following findings are likely to be found in this patient.
Which surgery is not a preferred for “bleeding gastric ulcer”?
False statement about Hereditary diffuse gastric cancer is?

options.label: A
options.text: It has a autosomal dominant inheritance

options.label: B
options.text: Gene involved is CDH1 (E Cadherin mutation)

options.label: C
options.text: It leads to Linitis Plastica of stomach

options.label: D
options.text: This condition is associated with higher risk of Infiltrating Ductal breast cancer

questions.correct_answer: D. This condition is associated with higher risk of Infiltrating Ductal breast cancer

questions.text: Treatment of choice for distal gastric cancer with stage T2 N1 stage is?
What is the best surgery for pancreas divisum?

A 35 year old male presented with pain abdomen, CT scan showed Bowel inside Bowel. During operation multiple polyps were found in resected segment of intestine. The patient had muco-cutaneous pigmentation. Histology of polyp revealed arborization of smooth muscle within the lamina propria. Which type of testicular tumour risk is higher in this patient?

A 38 year old patient presented with distended abdomen, recurrent vomiting and features of intestinal obstruction. He was passing some flatus and small amount of stool for last few days but his bowel habit is not normal. For last 20 hours he has not passed flatus or faeces and his distention and pain has increased. He has undergone bowel resection 6 years ago for abdominal trauma and transverse mesenteric tear. X ray in given below. What is the best treatment approach for him?

options.label: A
options.text: Do thin Barium meal follow through to rule out stricture at previous anastomosis site.

options.label: C
options.text: Manage conservatively by Ryles tube, antibiotics, NPO and supportive treatment

questions.text: Following IgA (image B) is seen in which condition?
A 4 week old child presented with recurrent bilious vomiting. BMFT showed corkscrew appearance in abdomen. What is the next best step for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Flatus tube insertion to reduce volvulus

options.label: D
options.text: Conservative treatment with Ryles tube and antibiotics

questions.text: False statement about Short bowel syndrome is?

options.label: A
options.text: Jejunal resection is tolerated better than Ileal resection

options.label: B
options.text: Increased Gall stone formation is due to decreased Bile salt absorption

options.label: C
options.text: Binachi operation is done for SBS

options.label: D
options.text: Risk of struvite renal stone is high

questions.correct_answer: D. Risk of struvite renal stone is high

questions.text: False statement Lu177 Dotatate treatment is?

options.label: A
options.text: It is approved for Neuroendocrine tumours

options.label: B
options.text: It is approved for only GIT tumours

options.label: C
options.text: It is approved for SRS negative tumours

questions.correct_answer: C. It is approved for SRS negative tumours

questions.text: Which of the following is not a radiological sign of intussusception?
Diversion colitis seen after end colostomy is due to deficiency of?

After complete removal of a sessile polyp of 2.0 cm by 1.5 cm found 10 cm above the anal mucocutaneous margin, the pathologist reports it to have been a villous adenoma that contained carcinoma in situ. Which of the following is a false statement about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It may present with Hypokalemic acidosis

options.label: B
options.text: In This case for Haggit type 4, anterior resection is the best surgical treatment.

options.label: C
options.text: It may present with Mckittrick Wheelock syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: Risk of such villous adenoma is higher in Peutz Jegher syndrome

questions.correct_answer: D. Risk of such villous adenoma is higher in Peutz Jegher syndrome

questions.text: False statement about angiodysplasia is?

options.label: A
options.text: It is acquired AV malformation seen in elderly patients.

options.label: B
options.text: Associated pulmonary stenosis is a common finding.

options.label: C
options.text: Caecum/Ascending colon is most common site of involvement.

options.label: D
options.text: Endoscopic diathermy is usually a sufficient treatment.

questions.correct_answer: B. Associated pulmonary stenosis is a common finding.

questions.text: A 32 years old man presented with Rt iliac fossa pain for 4 days with fever vomiting and anorexia. O/E there in tachycardia, pyrexia, RIQ tenderness, guarding and rebound tenderness with a vague lumpish feel. USG showed an appendix with 7 cm length and 6 mm width with periappendicular fluid collection. CT scan showed a appendicular mass with hypodense area around it. What should be ideal treatment for this patient?
Stage N1c Colorectal cancer is?

options.label: C
options.text: Metastasis in 7 or more regional lymph nodes

options.label: D
options.text: No regional lymph nodes are positive but there are tumor deposits in peri-nodal fat, mesentery or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal / mesorectal tissues

questions.correct_answer: D. No regional lymph nodes are positive but there are tumor deposits in peri-nodal fat, mesentery or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal / mesorectal tissues

questions.text: A 72 year old male presented in emergency with 24 hours history of abdominal pain distention and obstruction. X ray showed Freeman Dahl sign. Intraoperative picture is given below. What is the bets surgical procedure for this case?

options.label: C
options.text: Resection and colostomy with mucous fistula

questions.text: A 73 year old male who had undergone cataract surgery comes after 5 days with H/O of significant distention of abdomen and he hasn’t passed stool for 5 days. No feature of peritonitis was found but abdomen was grossly distended with absent bowel sound. X ray showed severly dilated colon with air in rectum and ceacal diameter of 10 cm. Which of the following is not used for the treatment of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Ryles tube insertion and keep patient Nil orally

options.label: B
options.text: Colonic decompression by cecostomy or sigmoidoscopy

questions.text: Which drug is not used for paralytic ileus?
In which condition of genetic inherited syndrome; colon cancer is seen at earliest age?
For T2 N1 colon cancer located in caecum, best surgical approach is?

options.label: A
options.text: Right hemicolectomy with excision through right branch of middle colic artery after Cattel Braasch manoeuvre

options.label: B
options.text: Right hemicolectomy with excision through left branch of middle colic artery after Cattel Braasch manoeuvre

options.label: C
options.text: Right hemicolectomy with excision through right branch of middle colic artery after Mattox manoeuvre

options.label: D
options.text: Right hemicolectomy with excision through left branch of middle colic artery after Mattox manoeuvre

questions.correct_answer: A. Right hemicolectomy with excision through right branch of middle colic artery after Cattel Braasch manoeuvre

questions.text: Which procedure is not done for fistula in ano?
Which rectal cancer is not an ideal case for trans-anal excision?

options.label: A
options.text: Tumour located within 12 cm from anal margin

questions.correct_answer: A. Tumour located within 12 cm from anal margin

questions.text: According to WHO classification MANEC should have

options.label: A
options.text: Equal component of adenocarcinoma and neuroendocrine tumor

options.label: B
options.text: Adeno and neuroendocrine in 25% and 75% ration

options.label: C
options.text: Adeno and neuroendocrine in 75% and 25% ration

options.label: D
options.text: Adeno and neuroendocrine each comprising at least 30% of tumour

questions.correct_answer: D. Adeno and neuroendocrine each comprising at least 30% of tumour

questions.text: CRS with HIPEC is not preferred for?
questions.correct_answer: A. Liver cancer with peritoneal secondaries

questions.text: A 48-year-old woman develops pain in the right lower quadrant while playing tennis. The pain progresses and the patient presents to the emergency room later that day with a low-grade fever, a WBC count of 13,000/mm3 and complaints of anorexia and nausea as well as persistent, sharp pain of the right lower quadrant. On examination, she is tender in the right lower quadrant with muscular spasm, and Carnett’s sign and Fothergill’s sign were positive. An ultrasound is ordered and shows an apparent mass in the abdominal wall. This condition is associated with all except?
Most common site for ischemic colitis are?

options.label: C
options.text: Recto-sigmoid junction and Mensen Bahr point

questions.text: False statement about left Paraduodenal hernia is?

options.label: A
options.text: It is most common type of internal hernia

options.label: B
options.text: It occurs below 4th part of duodenum

options.label: C
options.text: It occurs through space of landzert

options.label: D
options.text: It occurs behind inferior mesenteric artery

questions.correct_answer: D. It occurs behind inferior mesenteric artery

questions.text: A 10 months old child presented with intermittent crying, red mucous stool and tense tender abdomen and a sausage shaped lump at left of epigastrium and masking of liver dullness. What is the next best step for this child?
A 10 year old child presented with off and on Bleeding P/R. Tc 99 scan is given below. What is the best treatment for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Resection and anastomosis of bowel segment

questions.correct_answer: B. Resection and anastomosis of bowel segment

questions.text: Which of the follwing is best suture to do single layer bowel anastomsis?
Double Barrel esophagus in Barium swallow is seen in which condition?
Name the surgery shown in the image done for Meconium Ileus?
Hernia through the defect shown in the picture is?
Which of the following is correct regarding the boundaries of triangle of doom?

options.label: A
options.text: Medially vas deferens, laterally gonadal vessel, inferiorly peritoneum

options.label: B
options.text: Laterally vas deferens, medially gonadal vessel, inferiorly peritoneum

options.label: C
options.text: Laterally medial umbilical ligament, medially gonadal vessel, lateral inferiorly peritoneum

options.label: D
options.text: Laterally gonadal vessels and medially lateral umbilical ligament, inferiorly peritoneum

questions.correct_answer: A. Medially vas deferens, laterally gonadal vessel, inferiorly peritoneum

questions.text: Maximum weight loss is seen in?
